content.body: I prefer `#[` over `[|`, but I also prefer `|> #`over the two-tokens alternatives ðŸ˜‚ We could also just live with the conflict.`|> #[0]`will be a syntax error because the topic token is not used, and you will have to write`|> (#)[0]`. The only silent bug is when you want to use `#`twice and only once it's in a computed property access (for example,`|> #[#.length - 1]`, but it doesn't feel common: this is the only realistic example I could come up with, but we now have `#.at(-1)`.
